results.title: Sans Mobile Apparent = No Apparent Motive
results.brief_description:
It all starts with the bold murder of a well-heeled Frenchman. Commissaire Carella assigned to the case is most puzzled for there seems to be no motive. Then an old man and an astrologer are killed in exactly the same way, leaving the detective to figure out how the three disparate victims are linked. All he has to go on is a mysterious diary given to him by the step daughter of the first victim and containing a list of the man’s lovers.

Credits: Producers, Jacques-Eric Strauss ; director, Philippe Labro ; writers, Philippe Labro, Jacques Lanzmann ; photography, Jean Penzer ; music, Ennio Morricone.
Cast: Jean-Louis Trintignant, Dominique Sanda, Sacha Distel, Carla Gravina, Erich Segal, Gilles Segal, Laura Antonelli, Paul Crauchet, Stephane Audran, Jean-Pierre Marielle.

results.title: Sanjuro = Tsubaki Sanjuro [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: This samurai film, in which a shabby warrior helps young clan members root out corruption among the elders of their clan is a kind of sequel to “Yojimbo” with excellent fighting sequences and effective moments of humour. Toshiro Mifune reprises his role as the ‘man with no name’ from the earlier film. He is a shambling, scratching, bedraggled character described by many critics and a cross between Robin Hood and John Wayne, with a touch of Humphrey Bogart thrown in. With a heady blend of traditional Japanese theatrical conventions and the language of Western film-making this is a masterpiece of comedy-drama. Cast also includes Masao Shimizu and Tatsuya Nakadai. Also available on VHS [301895].

results.title: Sands of time
results.brief_description: This natural history documentary looks at Fraser Island, the world’s largest sand island and the only known one on which a significant rain forest exists. The geology of sand dune formation and dune movement, and the creation of the island’s freshwater lakes are clearly explained. The program looks at the ecological balance of the native plants and wildflowers and the introduced animals such as dingoes and brumbies as well as the growing pressures placed on the island from recreational fishing and tourism.

results.title: Sanding and finishing hardwood floors
results.brief_description: This do-it-yourself video guides the beginner on how to sand and finish hardwood floors. It will instruct you on preparing an old or new floor, loading and operating sanders and buffers, and correcting mistakes that may occur. It will also advise you on selecting a finish, filling cracks, appropriate application equipment and health and safety measures.
results.description: This do-it-yourself video guides the beginner on how to sand and finish hardwood floors. results.title: Sand paintings of the Western Desert: a demonstration (A)
results.creator_credit: Penelope Jools, Stephen O'Rourke and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Aboriginal artists, Paddy Garrol Tjungarrayi and Dinni Nolan Tjampatimpa, demonstrate the making of a sandpainting - a traditional art form intended to be impermanent. The paintings are made in a ritual manner and then destroyed as they are danced upon during a corroboree. Shows the adaptation of western technology by the Papunya people to this traditional art form.

results.title: Sand dunes: An introduction
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and Record Group and David Walton
results.brief_description: Begins by illustrating the formation of a sand dune and goes on to show how plant life becomes established. The animals population is also examined. From the series “Basic Ecology”.

results.title: Sand casting: an art adventure
results.creator_credit: Bill Mackie, Centron Films and Easy Street Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a young woman and several children making sand casts of several objects. The adult demonstrator shows the step by step procedure for making and decorating plaster of paris castings using inexpensive materials. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Sand and flame
results.brief_description: Open with a survey of the development of glass-making and the art of the early glass-blower. Shows manufacture of wide range of glass products, including the automatic bottle-making process; manufacture of fine glass tubing; transformation of glass marbles into glass fibre; production of glass bricks; furnacing, rolling, cutting, grinding and polishing of plate glass; manufacture of shatter-proof plate glass.
